features.situation: to other's intimidation skill due to your size

tnDqIwGN2ROMFZq8h.name: Increased ST for lower body
tnDqIwGN2ROMFZq8h.notes: Lifting only, no fine manipulators (-40%), SM 1 (-10%)

tqJhHA3JL4KH-R7zZ.name: Damage Resistance (Flexible; Tough Skin)
tqJhHA3JL4KH-R7zZ.notes: Flexible (-20%, doesn't protect against crushing damage); Tough Skin (-40%, doesn't protect against touch or scratches)

t-9jL3P1hFDVMXKMy.name: Enhanced Move (Running)
t-9jL3P1hFDVMXKMy.notes: Multiply normal Running Move by 1 + level

t0z1O5vvNQsk-mCKc.name: Overconfidence
t0z1O5vvNQsk-mCKc.notes: You must make a self-control roll any time the GM feels you show an unreasonable degree of caution. If you fail, you must go ahead as though you were able to handle the situation!

features.situation: from young or naive individuals who believe you are as good as you say you are

to9j8x7kUNHY-N6ye.name: Claustrophobia (Enclosed Spaces)
to9j8x7kUNHY-N6ye.notes: You are uncomfortable any time you can’t see the sky – or at least a very high ceiling. In a small room or vehicle, you feel the walls closing in on you... You need air! This is a dangerous fear for someone who plans to go underground.

nFTbkwrc3VIyEVhcn.text: Centaurs have the head, torso and arms of a human and the body, legs and tail of a horse.  Their upper bodies are somewhat larger than a normal human's (height is 8" more than usual, weight is 8 times normal).  They have very little hair on their upper bodies, though their females often have long silky tresses.  Centaur sages customarily shave their heads. Their lower bodies can be black, brown, grey, dappled, strawberry or even palomino.  Centaurs have no nudity taboo, but often wear clothing on their vulnerable human half for protection, warmth or decoration.  For some reason they seldom wear hats.  They never wear anything on their lower bodies (except, perhaps, a blanket when it's *very* cold).  The thought of wearing a saddle, harness or yoke is particularly odious to a Centaur.
